subject: Vam Pro Haptics
description_text:
Hi,

On the 25th I received my VAM Pro Haptics that I ordered on the 17th.   The
haptics seem very weak and do not properly change in strength with the gain
setting in either the Simsonn manager or in Simhub.   Regardless of if I
have it on 100% strength all the way down to 1% the strength of the motor
remains the same.

This is with the Pro X pedals that I purchased last year.   The control box
has been upgraded to CPU 1:V2.0.5 CPU2:V2.0.4.

Regarding the overall strength of the haptics.  I was previously running
the Simagic P-HPR Haptics on the pedals because your company's haptics were
not available when I purchased the pedals.  As it is currently your haptics
feel like less than 50% of the strength of the Simmagic ones.

Is this an issue with the firmware or software that is limiting the output
strength of the motors?

Can you please advise if this is an issue with the motors or the software?

Also I would suggest updating the support page on your website with clear
instructions on updating the firmware for the control box.

Thanks,
John La

conversations.body_text: Hi johnnalson la,  Hello, the ProX is designed for VAM motors, and its hardware does not support bidirectional motor control. Therefore, it cannot fully utilize the VAM Pro’s force. For reference, the Simagic motor has a thrust of 0.47 kg, while our VAM Pro provides 0.7 kg. To achieve the maximum vibration force of the VAM Pro, you can purchase the Pro X Ultra controller separately, which supports bidirectional control of the VAM Pro motor.      https://www.simsonn.com/products/simsonn-vam-pedals-haptic-reactor?variant=51399342293306

[image: a0eae507-5441-4534-a3e5-2a247d1b1278.jpg]
 So I need to specify after looking at my original purchase orders for the
pedals.  They were ordered February 27th of this year.    This unit looks
to be the one provided in the link in the last response.   Is this not the
correct controller?




On Sat, Nov 1, 2025 at 7:03 PM service@simsonn.com

Hi johnnalson la,  You can provide a screenshot of the SIMSONN Manager connection window so we can verify whether your device is a SIMSONN Pro X or a SIMSONN Pro X Ultra. The order information can also help us confirm this.

It's listed as a Pro X.
[image: manager.jpg]
When is the cut off date for "older" Pro X devices that would require the
new control box?


On Sun, Nov 2, 2025 at 10:02 PM service@simsonn.com

Hi johnnalson，  We can confirm that your controller is ProX. You may also consider purchasing the ProX Ultra controller, which offers more powerful vibration performance.      ​https://www.simsonn.com/products/simsonn-vam-pedals-haptic-reactor?variant=51399342293306
